question.question-text: What does the professor mean when he says this:

answer-list.answer-text: The students should already know it.
It will be explained later in the lecture.
The students need to answer his question.

question.explain-text: In the lecture, the professor mentions the Winchester House and the Winchester family and then goes on to say I don't think I need to tell you why the Winchester family is famous. From this, it can be determined that the professor means that the students should already know it when he says this. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which sentence best describes how the speaker feels about the Winchester House?

answer-list.answer-text: It was a fairly normal house for its time.
It appears to have been carefully planned.
It represents a common style of architecture.
It is notable for its haphazard design.

question.explain-text: In the lecture, the professor mentions an unbelievably wild profusion of rooms, corridors, stairways, doors, and windows and states that it had…can you believe it…more than 2,000 doors and 10,000 windows. From this, it can be determined that the Winchester House is notable for its haphazard design. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Why does the professor say this:

answer-text.exp: To announce what he is about to explain

answer-list.answer-text: To encourage the students to respond
To indicate that the answer is unknown
To suggest that the students should have prepared more

question.explain-text: In the lecture, the professor asks why do you think someone might build such a house and then goes on to say well, here is Sarah's story. From this, it can be determined that the professor says why do you think someone might build such a house in order to announce what he is about to explain. The first answer is therefore the best answer to the question.

question.question-text: How did Sarah seem to feel about the ghosts?

answer-list.answer-text: The house was haunted because of the way the way the family had achieved its wealth.
The house was not really haunted, but stories about ghosts helped the house to become famous.
The house may have been haunted, but she did not understand why.
She made up stories about the house being haunted to get sympathy.

question.explain-text: In the lecture, the professor says that Sarah became convinced that the family was being haunted by the ghosts of those victims of the Winchester rifle and mentions the ghosts that Sarah believed were haunting her family. From this, it can be determined that the house was haunted because of the way the family had achieved its wealth. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which sentence best describes the professor's view of ghosts?

answer-list.answer-text: He believes in them even more than Sarah did.
The fact that the house is haunted by ghosts makes it special.
He does not believe in them, but the fact that Sarah did is important.
He does not believe in them, and he thinks that Sarah did not either.

question.explain-text: In the lecture, the professor says that whether or not you believe in ghosts yourself, and…well…not everyone does…you can see that Sarah did. From this, it can be determined that the professor's view of ghosts is that he does not believe in them, but the fact that Sarah did is important. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.
